Seymour Myron "Sy" Hersh (born April 8, 1937) is an American journalist and political writer. He was born in Chicago, Illinois. He is a longtime contributor to "The New Yorker" and has also written for the "London Review of Books" since 2013.
He won the 1970 Pulitzer Prize for International Reporting. During the 1970s, Hersh covered Watergate for "The New York Times". In 2004, he received the George Orwell Award.
